EXIT   X

DUTIES OF PCBUs

Page

Table of Contents

 

Step 3: Control risks

 

A PCBU should consider control measures on a number of levels. If it is not reasonably practicable to eliminate the risk, a hierarchy of control measures should be used to minimise the risks.

 

Firstly:

 

•

substitute the hazard giving rise to the risk with something that gives rise to a lesser risk

•

isolate the hazard from people

•

put in place engineering controls

 

If a risk still remains:

 

•

implement administrative actions (for example, work procedures)

 

If a risk still remains:

 

•

provide personal protective equipment for use

 

For a control measure to be successful, you will usually need to support it with workplace training, instructions, information, supervision and the development of new and safer work procedures.
